title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 114.12 - Advertising requirements
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 114.12 - Advertising requirements

State Regulations
(a) An
advertisement for a cannabinoid hemp product, cannabinoid hemp processor or
cannabinoid hemp retailer shall not: (1)
include any false or misleading statements, images, or other content including, but not limited to, any health claims; (2)
contain claims that cannabinoid hemp or a
cannabinoid hemp product can, or is intended to, diagnose, cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent disease; (3)
lead
a reasonable consumer to believe that a cannabinoid hemp product is cannabis, or medical cannabis or that a licensee is authorized to sell or dispense
cannabis or medical cannabis, as those are defined in section
3
of the Cannabis

Law; (4)
have the purpose or effect
of targeting or being attractive to individuals under twenty-one (21) years of
age. The use of images of children or minors consuming cannabinoid hemp
products and the use of words, designs, or brands that resemble products
commonly associated with children, minors, or marketed to children or minors, is prohibited. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
114.12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
